column2: COLORADO DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 2. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column8: Alcohol does not
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit

column2: 3. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 4. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column8: curves right, then left.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Pass only in the right lane
column8: No left turn
column10: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: Traffic signal ahead
column10: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 8. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column8: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column10: share the lane with the motorcycle.

column2: 9. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column4: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.
column8: the pedestrian is deaf.

column2: 10. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: before moving into the exit lane.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: when you first see the exit sign.
column10: once you have moved into the exit lane.

column2: 11. You should increase your following distance when:
column8: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 12. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column8: green, yellow and red.

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column10: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 14. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 15. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 16. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column6: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column8: Blue indicates road user services.

column2: 17. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 18. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column6: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column8: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.

column2: 19. BAC is:
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the amount of alcohol in your body.

column2: 20. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column6: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column8: look over your left shoulder.
column10: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.

column2: 21. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column8: rectangle shaped.

column2: 22. The yield sign means:
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 23. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: traffic must merge right.

column2: 24. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column8: you cannot change lanes.

column2: 25. Emergency vehicles:
column4: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.
column8: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
